abstract: Big companies like Microsoft and Yahoo are making industrial-strength applications based on Web 2.0 principles, especially information sharing.
snippet: Big companies like Microsoft and Yahoo are making industrial-strength applications based on Web 2.0 principles, especially information sharing.
lead_paragraph: As the economy totters, it’s easy to make fun of the concept of “Web 2.0” — the rallying cry of a generation of chipper start-ups spawned over the last few years with an unusual aversion to vowels.
